Package model

Class ToDoList

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.ToDoList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ToDoList
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
This class extends Observable and implements Serializable for saving. Compiles task objects into contained lists and allows for updating of specified task fields and sorting.
Author:
Henry Do, Gerry Guardiola, Mauricio Brooks, Xin Li
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • ToDoList

      public ToDoList()
      Creates a ToDoList with the name List 1 and the color gray.

    • ToDoList

      public ToDoList​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a ToDoList with the given name. List is automatically colored biege. If given name is empty then the list will be automatically named unamed list.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the list.

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public java.lang.String getColor()
      Returns:
      The color of the list.

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(java.lang.String color)
      Changes the list's color to the given one.
      Parameters:
      color - The new color.

    • renameList

      public void renameList​(java.lang.String name)
      Renames the list to a new name and notifies the Observers that the list has been renamed.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name for the ToDoList.

    • getNameList

      public java.lang.String getNameList()
      Returns:
      The name of the list.

    • renameTask

      public void renameTask​(java.lang.String name, int pos)
      Receives String from input to rename specified task to the new string.
      Parameters:
      name - String containing the new task name.
      pos - Integer position of the current task being renamed.

    • addTask

      public void addTask​(java.lang.String taskName, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String deadline, java.lang.String importance, java.lang.String location)
      Adds a new task to the current viewable list.
      Parameters:
      taskName - The name of the task.
      description - The notes/description about the task.
      deadline - The deadline for the task. (Should be (m/d/yr))
      importance - Indicates whether the task is important or not.
      location - The String representing the location of the task.

    • removeTask

      public void removeTask​(int index)
      Removes task at a specified index from the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      index - Integer position of the task being removed.

    • amountTasks

      public int amountTasks()
      Returns:
      The amount of tasks in the ToDoList.

    • getTask

      public ToDoTask getTask​(int index)
      Gets the ToDoTask at the specified index. Assumes that index given is a valid index. Can make sure it is a valid index if the index is smaller than the int returned by the amountTasks method.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the task.
      Returns:
      The ToDoTask at the specified index.

    • loadView

      public void loadView()
      Notifys all observers by passing this List to it.

    • sortByDeadline

      public void sortByDeadline()
      Sorts the list of tasks by the deadline. The sooner a deadline is the higher the task will be placed on the list.

    • sortByImportance

      public void sortByImportance()
      Sorts the list of tasks by importance and also name. (Meaning letter A important tasks will be higher on the list than Z important tasks)

    • sortByName

      public void sortByName()
      Sorts the list of tasks by the name alphabetically.

    • sortByCreateTime

      public void sortByCreateTime()
      Sorts the list of tasks by the date that the task was created. The earlier the task was created the higher it will be placed on the list.

    • hideCompleted

      public void hideCompleted()
      hide completed task

    • showCompleted

      public void showCompleted()
      show completed task

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp​(int pos)
      Move the task up
      Parameters:
      pos - The index position of the Task to be moved up.

    • moveTop

      public void moveTop​(int pos)
      Move the task to top
      Parameters:
      pos - The index position of the Task to be moved to the top.

    • getCurrentSorting

      public java.lang.String getCurrentSorting()
      Returns how the list is currently sorted. Possible sortings are Name, Deadline, Importance, Create time, Custom
      Returns:
      The way the list is being sorted currently.

    • getHideComplete

      public boolean getHideComplete()
      Returns:
      True if the completed tasks are currently being hidden. False otherwise.
